Nordstrom Application Online–Print Job Employment Form
Apply for Jobs at Nordstrom Online
Application for Nordstrom: Nordstrom does not provide a printable job application. If you want to get a job at Nordstrom, you must apply for employment on the website by following the link above. Full-time or part-time positions may vary depending on the location.
Interview Tips: Go to the Nordstrom job interview questions&tips page.
Available Positions at Nordstrom: Cashier, Customer Service Representative, Stock Team Member, Retail Sales Associate, Accessories Sales Associate, Massage Therapist, Fitting Room Attendant, Kid’s Shoes Sales Associate, Women’s Apparel Sales Associate, Men’s Sportswear Sales Associate, Cosmetics and Fragrances Sales Associate, Shoe Shiner, Taylor, Jewelry and Watches Sales Associate, Cleaning Specialist, Wedding Stylist, Loss Prevention Associate, Customer Service Specialist, Department Supervisor, Assistant Manager, Store Manager, Administrative Assistant, Maintenance Technician, Merchandise Handler, Sales Counter Manager
Minimum Age to Work at Nordstrom : 16 years old (How old do you have to be to work at Nordstrom?)
Nordstrom Hours of Operation: Mon-Sat: 9:30am-9:00pm; Sun: 11:00am-7:00pm

Walmart The Nordstrom application presents you with employment opportunities in the retail industry. To find Nordstrom jobs in your area, apply online.
Nordstrom officially began as a shoe store called Willan&Nordstrom in Seattle, WA. The company built a long-standing, reliable customer base due to an effective business philosophy: offer the customer the best possible service, selection, quality, and value. Over the years, the Nordstrom chain grew and the company began to delve into other areas of the retail market. Today, Nordstrom is a chain of high-end department stores. The retailer focuses on selling upscale apparel, but also offers customers furniture, housewares, jewelry, beauty products, and much more.
Currently, the Nordstrom chain operates 115 department stores nationwide as well as a number of retail outlets under other banners, like Nordstrom Rack, Jeffrey Boutique, and Last Chance. As of 2009, Nordstrom employed over 52,000 workers. The retailer also had revenues of over $8 billion that year. Nordstrom is a publically held company and is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol JWN.
Based out of Seattle, Washington, Nordstrom is a high-end department store chain with locations across the country. Starting as a retailer focusing in footwear, the company now sells clothing, jewelry, beauty products, home décor, and furniture. Nordstrom is always hiring entry-level employees to work as sales persons in the aforementioned departments as well as in other capacities throughout retail stores.
Presently, Nordstrom stores around the country are looking to hire sales associates, cashiers, and merchandise handlers. These positions present a valuable opportunity for new workers: the chance to gain retail and customer service experience. Plus, the chain only requires that you be at least 16 years old to fill out the Nordstrom job application. With this useful experience, there is plenty of room for advancement into management or further your career in retail sales.
Employees who work an average of at least 129 hours a month are eligible for benefits packages in addition to regular pay. Employment perks include medical, dental, and vision insurance as well as a 401(k) plan and profit sharing. Qualified Nordstrom workers also receive paid time off and in-store discounts. Another perk available to all sales associates is commission pay. On top of base pay, employees earn back a certain percentage of their sales.
How would you like to find work with one of America’s fastest growing department store chains? If you want to enter a rewarding job in a casual and fun work environment, then fill out an application today. Nordstrom prefers that you apply online. It’s quick and easy.
